column1: bouncer first ball. Dug in short at a leg stump line and has Lewis avoiding this hurriedly
short and wide this time, and it's all hands from Lewis. Lifts his front leg slightly as he reaches out and cuts this over point
good length, leg stump, punched from the crease to mid-on
draws the outside edge, but it's gone through where fourth slip would have been. No feet again as he tries to drive on the up to a length ball at off stump, Jadhav cleans up at third man
full at leg stump, pushed to mid-on on the up
nice line. Just wide of the corridor at a good length, left alone
and he starts with a wide down leg side today as well. This one went with the angle
good length outside off stump, nips back in after pitching but the off stump is well covered as he lets it go. The ball lands in front of Dhoni who stops with his pads
beats the outside edge. Gets this to straighten from back of a length and has him poke outside off stump
back of a length, angling in from outside off, left alone
goes for the full one, but it's misfired. Exercise for Dhoni down the leg side
floats this outside off stump, bends it in from the wide marker, but it's still too wide for Lewis to hit
better line, much better. Curves it in towards the corridor this time, hits a good length. Lewis wary of the one that straightens is fending anxiously with a big gap. Inside edge onto pad
shot. Takes a step down the pitch and drives this firmly from outside off stump. Can't meat mid-off to his right
good length at off stump, solidly defended with a full face
nice and juicy, short and wide, but he can't time the cut. Chops it into the turf, It dribbles to Jadeja at backward point
back of a length outside off, slight movement in off the pitch. He pushes at it in front of his body and gets an inside edge onto his mid-riff
back of a length in the corridor, shuffles across, closes the face too late on the attempted glance. Square leg speeds in to field it
back of a length in the corridor, punched on the up, but not enough timing to get it past extra cover
back of a length, corridor, pushed to mid-off on the up and that's a maiden
back of a length and wide outside off, leans back as he looks to cut this, under-edged into the off side
good length, swinging in from outside off. Not as much as Lewis expects though. He prods inside the line and is well beaten on the outside edge
133kph, full and wide outside off stump. Asks him to chase and he does, but he's beaten once again. Wouldn't want to get in a street fight today...
short ball at the rib cage, defended comfortably
bangs it in behind a length, up in the corridor, bunted into the off side on the up
shuffles across now, looks to whip this length ball through the leg side. Inside edge onto the boot
good length outside off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, angled into the corridor, shuffles to tuck it to square leg
off the mark, finally. Shami misses his length slightly, and this is short enough for the pull, even with the persistent off stump line. Swung away behind square
short and wide outside off, skids low and takes the inside edge as he goes for the cut. Dhoni gets low very quickly, to his left, stops the boundary

good length ball at off stump, poked to mid-off...where Kedar Jadhav runs in and puts in a throw that defies cricketing angles. Mid-on is running in the opposite direction and can't back up with the dive backwards and midwicket is too far away to cut this off
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
swing away from the corridor, good length, left alone
looks to swing it away from a middle stump line this time, it goes down leg with the angle
ooooh close to the off stump. Nice length delivery in the channel, and Hope is brave to shoulder arms. Safe in the end
good length, off stump, pushed on the up to mid-off
short ball at middle stump, gets on his toes and covers the bounce nicely. Drops it pitchside on the leg side and Lewis calls confidently for the run
short and wide outside off stump, subdued cut shot, tapped gently to point
full outside off stump, he's playing inside the line over and over again and keeps getting beaten. Goes for the drive this time but is nowhere near it
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off. Some width there, but the ball climbs above the outside edge as he cuts
back of a length, corridor, defended into the off side. Wants a quick single, but short point is lurking
back of a length, corridor, back foot defence. Memorise it
Metronome Shami. Length, corridor, back foot bunt into the off side
back of a length, slight bait with the width, batsman happy to let it go and it's another maiden
back of a length, angled in at off stump, pushed to mid-off on the up
short and down the leg side, Lewis tears up at this generous offering. Perhaps why he can't connect on the expansive pull
connects this time! And it's sailed over the square leg boundary. Short and into the hips again, he swivels, gets under it and doesn't even look in the direction of the ball after he has dismissed it
back of a length outside off stump, a tentative push at it, thick outside edge to third man
yorker aimed for leg stump, slides through from under the bat as he looks to jam it out, cops it on the pad...apologies, there was an inside edge
good length, angled into the pads, tucked away to fine leg
good length, angled in, defended back down the pitch after a quick shuffle towards the off side
back of a length in the corridor, squeezed out to cover point
shuffles across. No secret where this ball is going to be. But he can't steal the single on the leg side, closes the face too late on this length ball in the corridor
back of a length outside off, slashes at this on the up, beaten by slight movement away off the pitch
good length, just outside off stump. Punched back straight off the back foot, Shami gets his left hand to it and makes mid-off's job easier
good length outside off stump, shuffles across, lets it go
back of a length, corridor, shovelled wide of mid-on off the back foot
full and down leg, clipped off the pads to fine leg
good shot. Not middled though, this punch on the up. Good length ball outside off, and Kohli runs to his right at mid-off. First confident drive from Lewis.
short and wide, left alone, lands in front of Dhoni who has had to use his pads a couple of times today
back of a length at off stump, pushed to midwicket on the up
back of a length outside off stump, looks to slash through the off side, gets it back down the pitch off the inside half
back of a length in the corridor, driven on the up, straight to extra cover
good length outside off stump, pushed on the up to extra cover
drifted in, good length, off stump, driven to extra cover
full at middle stump, driven past the non-striker and they push long-on on his throw
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length, drifts in viciously towards the pads, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
back of a length, angled into the pads, tickled to short fine's left. Lewis loud with the call again. Hope makes it at the other end with some struggle
back of a length, angled into the hips, whipped to deep square

offcutter, floated full at leg stump, flicked off the toes to deep square...and then he wants to hare back for the second. Hope is as stationary as the stumps at his end. Lewis has to hurry but there's no danger in the end
good length at off stump, defended back down the pitch off the front foot
offcutter again, good length, off stump, forward defence back to the bowler
offcutter, good length, turns it into the leg side on the up
offcutter, full outside off stump. Picked up like an offspinner and thumped hard after reaching the pitch. Mid-on dives to his left to stop it
overpitched outside off stump, sweetly timed cover drive is half-stopped by a diving extra cover
full at off stump, pushed back towards long-off, Jadeja fields. Obviously.
good shot. Steps down the track, meets this at the pitch after it drifts, and calmly lifts it wide of long-on
good length, flat at off stump, poked off the front foot to extra cover
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
back of a length at leg stump, can't get this glance away, thigh guard comes into use
offcutter...short. Outside off stump, Hope ducks it nice and early and this lands in front of Dhoni
another slower bouncer, again left well alone. This one carries
offcutter, good length, off stump, whipped. Straight to midwicket
back of a length, middle stump. Whipped to deep square leg. Oh and it was another offcutter
offcutter, dropped short and angled away from the left-hander. Punched off the toe-end to extra cover
channelling his inner Rajat Bhatia today. Another offcutter, good length, mistimed back foot punch to extra cover
good length outside off stump, pushed with the turn to extra cover
plays this well. Quickly down the track, reaches the pitch, negates the spin and clips yet another boundary wide of long-on
full at middle stump, dug out with a drive to long-on
good length, pushed through at middle stump, poked to midwicket
full ball, floated up at middle stump, driven back to the bowler
quicker one, back of a length at middle stump, hurries him as he looks to punch to long-on off the back foot. Then fields to his left
136 kph, length ball in the corridor, stabbed, down to third man
short and slightly wide outside off stump. Slashes hard, gets a thick outside edge to third man
offcutter, back of a length at middle stump, flicked off the hips to deep square
offcutter, back of a length in the corridor, and the first signs of spongy bounce. This climbs past his gloves
offcutter, good length, middle stump. Looks to clip it to deep square leg, but is forced to check his shot as this doesn't come on
offcutter, short and wide. Again, too little pace for Lewis' liking. Can't get useful connection on this cut
good length at off stump, driven on the up...Kohli dives to his left at extra cover
short and just outside off stump, spins away rapidly, gets the outside edge on the cut
flat, good length, off stump. Too quick for him to punch this to long-on
good length, drifted in at middle stump, defended off the inside half of the bat
back of a length at off stump, hurriedly tucked to long-on off the back foot
good length at middle stump, driven to midwicket on the up
Hope walks down the pitch. Pandya bowls him a bouncer. Umpire deems it's too high
good length at off stump, clears the front leg and clubs across the line...just gets it past Umesh Yadav at mid-on who considered a dive for a fleeting moment. It was travelling too quickly

holes out to sweeper cover. Pandya gets Kohli wickets. This is good length, outside off stump. Hope was visibly antsy, trying to open up and get quick runs. Makes him run down the pitch, that pressure, and slash away from the body. It's a leading edge that goes high into the off side and is taken easily
back of a length on off stump, punched towards mid-off
full on off stump, shows the full face to push to the left of mid-on
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to defend to midwicket
back of a length, drifting down leg. Looks to work it leg side, only gets pad on it down towards short fine leg
goes back to a length back on middle stump, tucks it into the square leg region
flat, angled into middle stump, punched to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
tossed up on middle stump, stretches out to flick to midwicket
fired in on middle and leg, clipped to backward square leg
short, angling across towards off stump. Looks to go back and across and work it through the leg side, extra bounce beats him and hits him on the stomach
length ball slanting into the corridor, goes a long way back and across to shorten the length and stab to backward point
shortish slower ball wide outside off. Lewis slashes and the ball keeps low, sneaks under his bat, and bounces a second time before reaching Dhoni

goes back to a fullish ball close to off stump, looks to chop into the off side. Lucky that the ball hits the toe of his bat and goes back to the bowler. Could easily have inside-edged into his stumps
shot. Full on off stump, overpitched, and Lewis swings smoothly through the line to loft over mid-off
shortish outside off, cut away to the right of the diving backward point fielder. Third man mops up
slower bouncer over off stump, Hope ducks
full outside off stump, and Lewis frees his arms once again. Lovely, full follow-through as he launches this high over mid-off
flat on off stump, goes back to defend to midwicket. 'Yeh accha hai,' MS Dhoni says (this is good).
a little straighter, goes back to work it through backward square leg
fired into the pads, quick and flat. No time to close his bat face and play that square, so he shows the full face to push towards mid-on
length ball on middle and leg, swept away to deep backward square leg

back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease, gets behind the line, and clips to midwicket. Wants to play that squarer but the line and the little bit of turn Jadeja achieves do not allow him to
ooh, nicely bowled. Drifts in towards off stump, straightens. Plays back when he should be forward, hurriedly jabs away into the covers
shorter now, outside off, slapped to deep point
stock ball turning down the leg side, worked down to long leg
tossed up, drifts in late towards off stump, driven to short extra-cover. Good stride forward this time

beautifully bowled. Down the track and the drift does Lewis in. He wants to drive this straighter, over mid-on, but it drifts into him, forces him to hit it squarer, and midwicket takes a good catch diving forward. The ball got too close to Lewis to let him free his arms fully

lovely. First ball drifts out towards off stump, turns back in. Good forward stride, defends back down the pitch. He'll be a lot more wary of playing across the line given the way he got out in the last match
fullish on middle stump, good stride out to defend into the on side
overpitched now, drifts ouside leg. Hope whips it away easily over midwicket
better length now, on leg stump, comes forward and shows the full face to push to long-on
ooh, some turn. Back of a length outside off. Went back and shaped to cut, but stopped himself seeing how much it turned
fuller, on the stumps, defended into the on side
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
floated up full on middle and off, driven past the diving bowler towards long-off
nice flight, drifting slightly away from off stump before turning back in. Defended back down the pitch
a touch short and he rocks back to punch in front of sweeper cover
full and flighted on leg stump, clipped through square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
ooh, drift and a bit of dip this time. Hope only half-forward in defence, this turns back in from outside off and rolls off the inside edge into the leg side
full on middle and leg, clipped to the right of long-on. Kuldeep, in trying to run around the ball to pick up with his left hand, misfields and allows a second
back of a length, a bit of drift in towards off stump and slight turn away. Goes back to punch into the covers
good ball, not quite as full as Chase imagined. A bit of flight on this occasion. Gets forward to drive inside-out, and the ball nearly carries to Kohli diving forward at short extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
full on off stump, pushed to the left of short extra. Hope doesn't ground his bat properly at the bowler's end, jumps in instead. Was in the air when Kohli's throw missed the stumps
driven to long-off, and Karthik, bending down to field the ball, takes his eyes off it and lets it roll through to the boundary, between his legs
tossed up outside off, whipped to long-on
full on leg stump, defended to midwicket
goes back to a length ball turning in towards off stump, tries to whip into the leg side. Ends up getting a thick bottom-edge into his pad
beauty. Tossed up enticingly, slanted across the batsman with some drift, and this is the googly that beats the outside edge of Chase's defensive bat
fuller, similar line, defended into the covers
a touch short on off stump, punched to the right of sweeper cover
full on middle and off, driven back to the bowler. Wanted to drive to long-off but a bit of inward drift changed the line of the ball
back of a length, close to off, dabbed to short third man
full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
flat, a little round-arm on off stump, goes back and chops to backward point
flighted ball close to off stump, driven inside-out to the sweeper
nicely played. That was a good-length ball that spun away from off stump. Chase gets forward, watches it well, and opens his bat face at the last moment to steer it into the fine third-man region
floated up on leg stump, swept to deep backward square leg
back of a length, pitches on off and doesn't turn in as Chase expects. Shapes to work it leg side, adjusts and defends into the covers
back of a length, turns in towards middle stump, whipped to deep square leg
interesting shot. Length ball on leg stump, goes deep in his crease and into a bit of a crouch to pull it to deep midwicket
floated up on off stump, and that's good placement. Clears his front leg to make room for the slog-sweep, and uses his wrists to place it square of deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, dips and turns and the attempted defensive push into the covers rolls to midwicket off the inside edge
full outside off, driven firmly to the left of short extra, where Kohli makes a diving stop
back of a length outside off, stops on the batsman slightly and his punch is momentarily airborne, but safely enough, placed towards sweeper cover
quicker now, back of a length outside off, stabbed away through point
a bit of flight on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
full on off stump, driven to long-off
once again, full on off stump, shows the full face for the push to long-off
tossed up just outside off. Gets a big stretch out and clips defensively to midwicket
on middle stump this time, gets a nice stride forward to flick to deep backward square leg
beats the outside edge. Goes back to try and defend a length ball pitching on off stump, doesn't pick the googly
tossed up higher, driven to mid-off
again, on the back foot to a length ball. Quicker too, hurriedly jams his bat down to defend his off stump
slower now, he can go back to this despite the length being similar. Googly, but the slowness allows him to pick it off the pitch and whip it from outside off down to long-on
short, a bit of width, slapped to deep point
back of a length outside off, steps back and across and works it to midwicket
bouncer rising high over off stump, Hope ducks just in case. Signalled wide, and that went a long way over the batsman's head
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
another bouncer, this one gets up to just around neck high, over middle stump. Keeps his eye on it and ducks
full and wide, doesn't really get his front leg across - he starts from a pretty open stance too - so he has to reach out to drive this. Slices it towards third man
back of a length on off stump, nicely played. Let that come on and dabbed with soft hands to the right of Jadeja at backward point
tossed up wide of off, dips a little on Chase. His attempted flat-bat drive through cover ends up rolling gently to mid-off

whoa, that's a replay of his third-ODI dismissal! Googly, tossed up beautifully outside leg. Chase gets his feet out of the way to try and whip into the leg side, misses completely since he was playing for the stock ball, and the ball turns past his outside edge and clips the top of middle stump. Ball then ricochets and hits Dhoni's helmet grille
tossed up outside off, defended to short extra-cover
nicely bowled, some drift away from the right-hander again and drops onto a length that makes him stretch to defend into the covers
fuller now, outside off again, defended to the left of short extra-cover
googly now, flatter, pitching on leg stump - line was a bit of a giveaway, maybe - and he goes back to defend into the off side
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs to the left of backward point, who gets a hand to the ball with a dive
length ball close to off stump, pushed towards point from the crease
full, a bit of width, driven to deep point
back of a length outside off, watches it well and dabs to third man
bouncer, angling in and rising over leg stump. Mohammed steps across and dips his left shoulder under the ball
full on off stump, defended towards mid-on
short on leg stump, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length, pitching on middle. Goes back, maybe looking for the punch down the ground initially. Turns sharper than he expects and he has to adjust and whip to midwicket
a touch too short, and he pounces on it. Back in a flash, makes some room, and slaps to the right of extra-cover
again a touch short, this time it's a little quicker and he chops it downwards, into the ground, to the left of Kohli at short extra
tossed up full outside leg, clipped to deep midwicket
wrong'un, pitching fairly full on middle and leg. Seems to pick it, defends inside-out to short extra
shortish on off stump, goes back and across and pulls to deep square leg
back of a length, angling towards leg stump, worked away to fine leg

Ouch. Bouncer just outside off. Hope steps back and across and looks to pull, but the ball stopped on the pitch a little - Pandya rolled his fingers over at release - and he's through his shot too early. Ball smacks into the grille of his helmet. He calls for a replacement
bangs it in again. This time it's angling in and Hope ducks under it. Bounces well over head height
full, wide of off. Gets a good stride forward for a checked drive to the sweeper
length ball on off stump, gets forward for a push through cover point

cross-seam ball, back of a length outside off. Hope looks to open his bat face and steer it down to third man, but the ball straightens just a touch, with just a hint of extra bounce, and Dhoni falls to his right to pouch the nick
good length, slight tail back in towards off stump and he finds the inside edge before he finds the pad
bouncer, bit too short, comfortably ducked

another inside edge. Shami was hitting the corridor in his first spell, now he's looking for some reverse. This moves in slightly off the pitch from a length. He's playing in front of his body and hits another one onto pad
in the air but no danger. A back-of-the-hand slower ball this time, tossed up nice and full outside off. Gets him to go for the cover drive, with barely any control
good length, angled into the pads, clipped to deep square leg's left
back of a length at middle stump, dropped behind square on the leg side off the back foot
bouncer angled in at his chest, but he has several hundred feet of height to negotiate this. Goes for the hook, gloves it fine
full and angled into the corridor, driven firmly on the up to mid-off
full and fast, middle stump, but strategically pushed with enough mistiming to steal a single from mid-on
good length, wide outside off stump. Wafts at it away from the body, beaten. Yet another cross-seam delivery
cross-seamer. Full and wide outside off stump, sliced off the front foot to sweeper's left
good length at off stump, looks to steal a single with the forward push, but Kohli has been faultless there today
offcutter in the channel, good length, run down to third man
full at leg stump, short stride in to poke this to mid-on for another quick run
slower ball, short and wide outside off stump. Slashes at it, gets a thick outside edge. It lands well in front of Karthik at third man...he watches it into his hands

short and wide outside off stump, slapped on the up in front of square. Kuldeep does well at sweeper cover to run to his right. Has it covered for a long time but puts in the dive a bit too late. In the end, it's a lot of pushing and dodging and acrobatics as he tumbles at the ropes. A matter of frames...and it's in his favour
full delivery aimed for leg stump, toe-ended drive to mid-on
low full toss, bit of inswing, but it's on the pads. He flicks...and gets it past midwicket, but only after he gets a hand on it
caught down the leg side and it's given. A back of a length ball, angled down leg side. Not a particularly fast ball either. Just an unlucky dismissal as he tries to tickle this fine
good length, wide outside off stump. Doesn't chase it
length ball in the corridor, dabbed down to third man
back of a length, off stump, drops it towards backward point...and his partner has the cheek to consider a run. Back you go, says Jadeja, with a bullet throw
good length at off stump, solidly defended into the off side
length, off stump, walks into the forward push and gets it out to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off stump, emphatically cut to sweeper for one
back of a length at off stump, spins in and bounces, pushed to midwicket

a stunning delivery that slips through the gate from a good length. Dhoni appeals and caught behind is given. Powell has reviewed it. Snicko shows there's no edge...but his leg is in front of middle stump as the ball brushes it. He could be out lbw here...oh, nope. That's spinning over and past leg stump. The review works out in the end. A nice loopy delivery from Kudleep, not picked at all as he nearly fell over trying to drive into the off side
wrong'un, tossed right up at off stump, driven to mid-off
nearly defends back onto his stumps. Playing him off the pitch without a clue right now, and it's forcing him to play late. This time, he goes back to the length ball and nearly plays on
wrong'un. length at off stump. He's right forward this time and gets an outside edge that lands short of first slip
good length down leg, mistimed flick and an aimless trek down the track. Sent back promptly
full and down leg side, no bat this time
length outside off stump, pushed out to sweeper cover off the front foot
full and tailing into the pads, clipped out to deep square leg
back of a length in the corridor, shapes to pull, adjusts to bunt it behind point

good catch. Only Jadeja can make running backwards look so simple. This is back of a length and climbing in he corridor. He swipes across the line to try and pick the midwicket boundary but it's a leading edge that lobs up and swerves awkwardly as cover, backward point and sweeper cover all show interest. Jadeja's call is the loudest and they let him be. Adjusts his steps to perfection, shimmies slightly to his left after running back and holds on
short ball at the ribs, leaps off the ground and gloves this to Dhoni's left
good length at off stump, forward defence to extra cover

a straightforward one at backward point this time. Short and wide, and honestly, an average delivery. In the slot for the cut, but the mind doesn't always back you up at this level. Tentative in his approach and he hits it straight to Jadeja
angled across off stump, back of a length, left alone
good length, angled in at off stump from around the wicket, no-feet defence
full at off stump, pushed into the off side. Jadeja swoops, Jadeja throws, and misses at the non-strikers
short ball outside off, stands tall and regal as he looks to pull this, but it's anti-climactic. Rolls out to midwicket off the bottom of the bat
full and swinging away towards off stump, poked into the covers
back of a length at off stump, backs away to find a single through third man, hits it straight to backward point
edged but no slip. Expansive drive on the up to this length ball. It's angled across him and draws the edge, work for third man
short ball at the rib cage, gets inside the line, lifts his front leg across, tucks it to fine leg
good length at off stump, solidly defended into the covers
good length, angled across off stump, opens the face and guides it to third man
back of a length outside off stump, uses his wrists to push the back foot defence into the leg side
wrong'un, good length at off stump, picked and defended off the front foot
tossed up at middle stump, gets low and sweeps it to deep square leg's right
good length, middle stump, paddle swept to deep square's left this time
good length outside off stump, left alone
wrong'un, good length, middle stump. Forward defence
bouncer at middle stump, defended off the back foot
offcutter at leg stump, uppishly flicked out to deep square leg
bouncer at middle stump, controlled hook shot to deep square leg
back of a length of middle stump, defended off the back foot
nails the yorker at middle stump, but Bishoo is resolute in defence
bouncer at middle stump, startles him slightly, but he fends it into the leg side for a single
full and drifted into the pads, hits them too
short and wide, hangs back and punches it to sweeper cover
wrong'un, too short, thick outside edge on the cut
tossed up, full toss outside off stump. Nurses eyes light up but feet stiffen. Thrusts his bat at it, but it's only one to sweeper cover
length at middle stump, flicks against the turn for a lob towards long-on
back of a length outside off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
good shot, but only one. Anticipates the full one on the stump, backs away and drives with the full face. Mid-off dives to his left to stop it
slower bouncer, picked well, but there's no pace for that hook to go the distance. Lands well in front of deep square leg
ding ding ding. Bishoo has invented a new shot. Backs away, and looks to reverse-hook this bouncer. But as with most batting inventions from lower order batsmen, this yields nothing
high elbow this time. Drives this overpitched ball to long-off
rolls his fingers on another bouncer. It squeezes through from under this attempted pull
inswinging yorker at off stump, dug out and back to the bowler. Can't do much else
short ball in the mid-riff, gets the front leg out of the way and pulls to deep square

top edge, helmet grille, diving fast bowler and Nurse is done. Length ball hurries him as he stays put in the crease and looks to whip across the line. Hits the back of the bat, smashes the grille and lobs up to Umesh's right. He dives across the pitch and gets his third
bouncer, too short, too wide down the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, dropped in front of midwicket off the back foot
offcutter, grips the pitch and climbs as he plays the back foot defence. Forces him to take the bottom hand off
another steep offcutter, this one lifts from a length and goes over his attempted pull shot
slower ball, short and wide outside off, lifted over point with a check-cut, two more
good length outside off stump, opens the face and pushes it to point off the front foot. Wild throws comes in at the non-strikers...long-on has to run across but they won't take the overthrow
short ball at middle stump, backs away and is beaten as he looks to nudge this through the slip region
short one at middle stump, fends it awkwardly, and aerially, back down the pitch

too easy for Jadeja. Good length at off stump, opens the face and hits it straight to point. He would've struggled on the best of days, but today he hesitated before the run as well. Jadeja knows this. Gathers the ball, balances himself, hops two steps and takes down the middle stump at the non-strikers end
bouncer. No clue. Looks to hook, is very late on it, but the top edge falls well in front of Dhoni
good length outside off stump, driven on the up to extra cover
yorker at leg stump, toe-poked, cricket style of course. It dribbles past his partner, the No. 10 batsman, but Mr. 11 refuses the very simple run. Alzarri is an angry man
good length at off stump, opens the face and squeezes it square on the off side
back of a length at middle stump. Backs away and gets it in the slot for the slog, but it's an inside edge onto boot
backs away and gets another one in his range. But this is a slower ball, so the timing doesn't come. Slices it in the end, gets it over mid-off and returns for the second
low full toss, swinging in for leg stump, slogs across the line. Gets it to midwicket off the bottom of the bat

good length outside off stump, heaves across the line and gets a leading edge to third man's right...wants to come back for the second run which is there for the taking. Should be a second even if it isn't there for the taking. But this time, Alzarri says no. And another argument ensues between the bowlers as they walk off the field. Yeesh...
starts with a short one just outside off, Rahane leans back and stabs firmly to backward point
full outside off, driven to the right of mid-off, where Holder makes a diving stop

back of a length on off stump, Rahane steps across smartly and places that clip beautifully, beating the square leg fielder diving to his right. By the time fine leg comes around to stop it, he's already on his way back for a second

ohh, nearly an early breakthrough. Quick short ball, rising over Rahane's right shoulder. Takes on the hook, top-edges it, and the fielder at fine leg, Chase, doesn't come in quickly enough for it to be a chance. Bounces some six feet in front of him
back of a length outside off, defended towards cover point
short and down the leg side, pulled around to long leg
length ball pitching a fair way outside off and slanting further away, left alone
shortish, angling down leg. Dhawan misses the flick off the hip and there's a loud, hopeful appeal for caught behind. Was close to his gloves but not close enough
shortish outside off, chopped down to gully
shot. That isn't a half-volley, but it's wide enough, and Dhawan gets a nice stride out to drive to the left of cover point
back of a length close to off stump, doesn't quite come on to the bat as Rahane looks for the push into the covers. Inside-edge, into the pad and then rolls into the point region
short, just a bit of width, cut away crisply to the left of gully, down to third man
back of a length outside off, left alone
gone, soft dismissal. That's full on leg stump, and Dhawan looks to flick but fails to keep it down and lobs up a simple catch to wide mid-on
length ball, fifth-stump line. Kohli takes a walk right across his stumps and defends to short extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across and clips to square leg
length ball, sixth-stump line, left alone
back of a length on middle stump, tucked down to square leg
back of a length again, hits the deck hard in the fourth-stump channel. Kohli's defensive shot rolls to square leg off the inside half of the bat
full, angling into off stump, driven smoothly to mid-on
shortish outside off, stops on Rahane slightly. His back-foot slap ends up going straighter than he perhaps wanted, over cover, but well wide of the man at short extra
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler

appeal for lbw as Holder seams this in from just outside off stump and Rahane, hanging back, ends up playing outside the line while trying to work it into the leg side. Too short to get an lbw decision, though - was probably going over the stumps and also missing leg
fullish, just outside off, Rahane is nicely forward for the checked drive to mid-off
short, just outside off, Rahane misses the pull - was through his shot too early
length ball on middle stump, Kohli clips it away through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
short, angling into middle and leg, and Rahane is in position in a flash, back leg across and open at the hips, to pull it over square leg
and again. This one's short and angling into off stump, and Rahane hooks it around to the left of the man at long leg
that's a good ball, a rising short ball on off stump. Goes back to punch and it climbs and hits him on the glove
length ball, fourth-stump channel, Rahane gets his head nicely over the ball and defends towards point
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
good bouncer, just outside off, Kohli looks to hook and it climbs over his outside edge
ooh, stops on him slightly. Shortish outside off, Kohli looks to punch with firm hands, and the inside-edge hits his back pad
back of a length, angling into off stump, punched back down the pitch, to the bowler's right

for the second match in a row, Holder has dismissed Kohli after troubling him with the short ball. Good bouncer, just outside off, similar to the one that he missed a few balls ago. This time he gets a top-edge that goes straight up, three storeys up, and Shai Hope takes a few steps forward and wraps his gloves around it
full outside off and that's well played by Rahane, sinks down on his back knee and plays late, opening his bat face, to drive through point
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers

whoops. Holder at mid-off, gets down on one knee to field this uppish drive from Rahane - the ball stopped on him and he checked his shot - and it bounced a few feet in front of him and slipped through his legs

dropped! West Indies really need to hold these. Length ball angling into the pads, and Rahane flicks uppishly, straight to square leg at shoulder height, and the ball slips out of his grasp before he can wrap his fingers around it. You'd call that a dolly. Jason Mohammed is the fielder
ooh, good ball. On a good length, seaming back in from outside off. Karthik stays on the back foot, looks to defend slightly away from his body and the inside edge cannons into his pads
full on middle and off, defended to mid-off
full, close to off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball angling into off stump. Rahane is a touch late getting forward, still on his heel when he looks to push into the covers. The ball hits his inside edge and rolls down to fine leg
back of a length, fairly wide of off, left alone
short outside off, left alone
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone
full outside off, driven crisply but mid-off dives right and makes an excellent stop. Holder makes partial amends for his misfield from Joseph's last over
shortish outside off, stabbed to backward point
good ball, full and angling into off and middle from wide of the crease. Defended into the covers
full, a lot of width, and Rahane drives with a high left elbow. Looked great, but he hit it straight to cover
back of a length, a bit of inward movement from outside off, defended towards backward point
back of a length, close to off stump, defended with soft hands into the gully region
back of a length, fairly close to off stump, left alone
back of a length, slightly wider, Karthik leaves again
digs it in short, angles it in and Karthik gets his hands high up to defend - hits him on the glove but he plays close to his body and the ball drops down softly next to his feet
short outside off, keeps low and goes under Karthik's attempted pull
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended into the point region
back of a length a fair way outside off, left alone
full on middle and leg, Rahane flicks into his pad. Thick
overpitched, just outside off, and Rahane drives between non-striker and mid-on. Brought more bottom hand into the shot than he typically does
back of a length outside off, stabbed firmly to backward point
shortish on off stump, cramps Rahane a little while he tries to pull. Drags it to the right of square leg off the inside half of the bat
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, a bit of inward movement towards off stump. Watches it well, stays slightly leg-side of the ball and defends towards backward point
slower ball on middle stump, clipped down to long leg
back of a length, angling down leg. Karthik can't connect with the flick off the hip
once again, angling down leg. This time Karthik lifts his bat above his head, looks to step across and leave, but the ball clips his hip on the way through to the keeper
back of a length, just a hint of width, punched crisply between cover point and extra-cover
length ball on off stump, nice stride forward to defend to short extra-cover
length ball on off stump, stays on the back foot and defends to midwicket. Then he shadow-practices a forward defensive
bouncer over off stump, Karthik bends nicely at the waist and knees, and sways his upper body out of the line
full outside off, and that is a sweet, sweet drive. Just shows the full face of the bat, and mid-off is far too wide to be anywhere near its path
short, angling into off stump. That may have bounced less than Rahane expected, only getting to waist height, but he watches it closely and plays a short-arm swat out to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends with soft hands. The ball rolls to the left of backward point

another good, short ball. Another wicket. The shoulder-high bouncer outside off, and Karthik is late on it. The ball hits high on the bat, the outside half near the sticker, and loops up to the right of the keeper
greets him with a short ball on off stump and he swivels round swiftly to pull towards long leg
short, angling into middle stump. Rahane stays leg-side of the ball, jumps to ride the bounce, and blocks it back towards the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
shortish, angling into off stump, takes a big step back and across and tucks it through backward square leg
back of a length, close to off stump, defended to cover point
shortish, close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs down towards gully
back of a length outside off, Dhoni lets it come on and dabs softly into the point region
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, clipped through square leg
short, angling towards leg stump. Jumps across to try and clip towards fine leg. Gloves it into his side, and Hope dives left and stops the ball from rolling away for runs
fuller now, down the leg side again. Dhoni misses the flick
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to nudge it through square leg
slower ball, fairly full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
shortish, angling into off stump, gets on his toes to defend back towards the bowler
very full and wide of off stump, left alone
tossed up on middle stump, defended inside-out to short extra-cover
shortish on off stump, makes room and slaps to short extra-cover
fuller now, on off stump, gets on the front foot and jabs to short extra-cover
beautifully bowled. Drifts it into leg stump, slows it down, makes Dhoni reach out to defend. He's nowhere near the pitch and it spins past his outside edge
flat, quick legbreak wide of off, left alone
full and angled into the pads, turned away to fine leg
back of a length, angling into the pads and more easy runs with a push to fine leg
he needs to tighten up, does Kesrick. Slides another length ball into the pads, tucked away to fine leg
misses length on his offcutter, it's a full toss wide outside off stump. Dhoni reaches out and taps it past cover point. Rahane calls early and comes back for the third
good length, leg stump line, defended to mid-on
angles it in from length, at off stump. Rahane decides to stay back for it, and is shaping to punch through the off side. Quickly adjusts to block it out
good length at off stump, defended into the off side with no feet
good length , off stump, driven gently to extra cover
full ball drifted down leg side, carefully watched before feathering it behind to an empty fine leg region. Rahane comes back for three again
back of a length outside off stump, shapes to punch, check-pushes to extra cover
nicely behind it this time, middles the back foot drive to this wide short ball
inside edge. Nicely tossed up outside off, but Dhoni goes too hard at it. Inside edge onto boot bobbles up in the air near the pitch
loud, manic appeals from the bowler and some fielders. Nothing from the keeper who is busy leaping to his left to catch what is eventually called a wide. No review
back of a length in the corridor, defended to backward point off the back foot
full and aimed for the off stump, solidly defended back to the bowler
length outside off stump, keeps low as he tries to open the face on this, under-edge
short ball in the channel, sliced to backward point
overpitched offcuter, wide outside off stump. Left alone
shuffles and waits on the back foot, watches this short ball nicely and keeps the pull shot down from middle stump, finds deep square
overpitched outside off stump, gets to the pitch, whips across the line to long-on
short and wide outside off stump, hammered with a closed face to long-off
full outside off stump, carved inside-out through the covers
full, flighted delivery at middle stump. Steps out and yorks himself, pushes it back to the bowler
short outside off, chopped to sweeper cover

poor ball. Dropped well short, sits up nicely on an off stump line. Rahane gets the front leg out of the way quickly, transfers the weight back and gets slightly under this pull shot. It goes in the air, but it's wide of and speeding past Kesrick at midwicket
legcutter, floated up at off stump, defended off the inside half of the bat
short of a length, off stump, behind the line to defend off the back foot
good length, starts on middle stump and thuds into the thigh guard as he looks to brush it fine
offcutter, length at off stump. Dhoni leaning into the defensive push early, can't get it past point
offcutter is dropped short and wide this time, angled bat prod to third man
short ball, wide outside off stump, Lets it go
overpitched outside off stump, driven straight to extra cover
back of a length at leg stump, back foot punch to long-on
slider, pushed wide outside off stump, left alone
orthodox legspin, short and a tad wide, cut to sweeper cover's right
good length outside off stump, spins away sharply as he lets it go
dropped short, hangs deep in the crease and taps it to deep midwicket with a pull
short and a tad wide outside off, poked to backward point
offcutter, full and wide, Dhoni not interested
back of a length, cramps him, can't get the glance behind square
back of a length, slides into middle stump, thick inside edge down to fine leg
legcutter, good length at off stump, defended
short and in the channel, mistimed cut to backward point on the bounce
pushed through flat, back of a length at off stump. Makes room, can't hit it into the off side
drifted full and flat outside off stump, leans in and brings the bat down hard with a full face, single to long-off
full at off stump, uses his wrists to push it towards long-on, midiwicket cuts the single
full at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length, middle stump, goes on the back foot and taps it to long-on
short outside off stump, pushed through quickly, cut straight to backward point
length ball into the pads, flicked to fine leg
good length at off stump, solidly defended off the back foot
good length, pings him on the pads as he looks to flick with the angle
full and woefully down the leg side, more leaping for Hope and he comes through
another one angled down leg, Dhoni is cramped on the glance, it brushes his pads and once more Shai Hope is there to pull off an acrobatic stop
overpitched outside off, leans into it, looks to drive past extra cover, can't get it past
short ball at off stump, makes room quickly and chops it to cover point
pushed through flat, back of a length at middle stump, toe-ended back foot push to midwicket
good length at middle stump, stretches forward, rolls the wrists and tucks it into the leg side with soft hands to bring up his fourth consecutive ODI fifty
full outside off stump, sliced out to sweeper cover
overpitched at leg stump, feebly pushed to short midwicket
full outside off stump, tapped to sweeper cover off the front foot
tossed up outside off, gets to the pitch and hits a crisp cover drive to fine sweeper
full at off stump, driven towards long-off, extra cover covers to his right. With his foot
full at off stump, finds extra cover with the drive again
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full outside off stump, driven to extra cover
back of a length at middle stump, turned off the back foot to deep midwicket
overpitched outside off, driven to long-off
good length outside off stump, not to the pitch, inside edge on the attempted cover drive
good length at off stump, Dhoni leans in and pokes it out to backward point
full on the toes, clipped to deep square leg's right
good length at off stump, defended back down the pitch
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
short and wide outside off stump, finds cover with the cut shot
tossed up at off stump, driven down the ground, to long-on
back of a length outside off stump, Dhoni <strike>rips his shirt off, howls like a werewolf, dances down the track and creams this to Bermuda</strike> goes on the back foot and drives to long-off
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, forward defence
full at leg stump, pushed through the square leg region off the front foot
good length at middle stump, flicked to short fine
good length at middle stump, steps down the track and doesn't get to the pitch. Has to extend his arms to keep this flick on the ground and get it past square leg
full outside off stump, driven to long-off
full outside off stump, forward stride, driven to long-off
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven to...you guessed it...extra cover
short ball outside off stump, rocks back and cuts, gets it past the inner circle...but there's a sweeper
full at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler

Rahane has gone for a sweep, missed it entirely and it looks like he's been given out caught behind. Yes. He has reviewed straight away. There's a minuscule spike on Snicko as the ball passes the bottom of the bat. Earlier inspection shows the ball had hit his hip before the keeper took it...and he's given out because of the spike. This was a regulation legspinner, going away from off stump. Rahane stretched out for the sweep and evidence suggests the ball has kissed the toe end of the bat before hitting his hip
back of a length at off stump, pushes against the turn into the leg side, off the back foot
good length, off stump, front foot poke to extra cover
good length, off stump, front foot poke back down the pitch
back of a length at middle, pushed to straight midwicket
full at off stump, drives it to extra cover's right. He dives, parries it to long-off
good length at middle stump, forward defence into the leg side
good length, middle stump, tucked into the square leg area
full, off stump, extra cover
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
good length outside off stump, not to the pitch, uses his hands to reach and get a single to cover
back of a length outside off stump, climbs sharply and takes the top edge as he looks to cut, runs past backward point
oooooh close. Full, flat delivery pushed through at middle stump. He gets the front leg across and somehow connects with the sweep, gets it fine
good length at off stump, driven to extra cover
down the track comes Jadhav, flicks it over midwicket from off stump. Lands in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
tossed up fairly wide of off, stretches forward, waits, and chops it into the short third-man region
floated up outside off, reaches with his hands and jabs it back towards the bowler
ha ha, he's doing this just to troll the last commenter. Tossed up a little wider, reaches out with his hands and pokes into the covers
goes on the back foot now to the flatter ball on off stump, blocks to midwicket
flat again, on middle stump, Dhoni plays a back-foot defensive flick back to the bowler
flat and quick, fairly wide of off, left alone
tossed up now, achieves some drift in towards off stump, blocked into the covers
length ball on off stump, slides on with the angle, punched back to the bowler
a touch short, goes back and cuts to backward point
tossed up wide of off, lovely hands from Jadhav to sweep that through backward square leg
short, a bit of width, slapped to the left of sweeper cover
shot. Back of a length outside off, leans back and stabs it deftly to the left of short third man, who chases back and pulls it back near the rope
back of a length on off stump, goes back to pull but can only hit it back to the bowler
back of a length on middle and leg, makes room to punch down to long-off

gone, bat-pad! That was a slightly lazy defensive shot from Jadhav, barely a stride forward to a well-flighted ball outside off. A bit of dip, some extra bounce, and the inside-edge hits pad and lobs up into the short-leg region. The keeper moves quickly to his left, dives, and grabs it with one glove
back of a length, turning in towards off stump, goes back to stab towards backward point
flighted ball outside off, long stride forward to smother it
tossed up close to off, jabbed to short extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, makes some room and dabs towards backward point
short, very wide outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, jabbed towards point
flighted ball on off stump, pushed out to long-off
back of a length, close to off stump, goes back to defend, plays for slightly more turn than there was, and it rolls into the leg side off the inside half of the bat
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
back of a length on middle stump, worked through wide mid-on
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
length ball pushed through quicker on middle stump, goes on the back foot and nurdles it away through square leg
length ball turning in towards middle and leg, drives with a straight bat to midwicket
length ball on off stump, pushed into the covers and they take a belated decision to run a single. Gets there easily enough
back of a length on off stump, waits for it to come on and jabs into the point region

shot! If he meant it. digs it in short, angles it in over off stump, and he leans away, and I'm not sure if he was looking to leave it or ramp it wide of the keeper. In the end, it was ball hitting bat rather than bat hitting ball, and it flew away to the fine third man boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length outside off, punched to short extra-cover
shortish, some width, but it doesn't come on for the cut. Drags it back towards the bowler off the inside half of the bat
flighted ball outside off, reaches out to jab to short extra-cover
steps out now and he fires it into his pads, clips carefully to midwicket
length ball on off stump, defended into the on side
flat and quick length ball on middle stump. Stays back to defend back to the bowler

tossed up slower on middle stump, takes a stride out and closes his bat face to place it to the right of midwicket. Holder throws off balance, to the bowler's end, well wide, and concedes an overthrow
down the track again and Nurse shortens his length, nurdled to midwicket
back of a length, angling into off stump, punched to the right of mid-on
back of a length, close to off stump, punched gently into the covers
back of a length, fairly wide of off, left alone
slower ball, almost on a yorker length on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
slower ball, fairly full on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
shortish, a bit of width, can't beat backward point with his cut
length ball turning towards middle stump, shows the full face to punch down to long-on
down the track and Nurse shortens his length, close to off stump, clips to straight midwicket
down the track again, bowls it shorter and quicker, just outside off, punched back to the bowler
back of a length and quick, on off stump, goes back to whip to square midwicket
down the track and this time he shortens his length a touch too far. Looks to pull, can't really time it, drags it to the left of backward square leg
short, angling down leg. Dhoni misses the pull as this keeps low and hits the left pad that he's just swung towards the leg side to give himself hitting room
fullish slower ball outside off, leans forward, gets his head over the ball, and clips to long-on
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and looks to dab into the off side for a single. Backward point moves quickly to his right to deny him
slower ball on a length wide of off. Reaches out uncertainly with an angled bat and it bounces loopily to beat his outside edge
length ball on off stump, clipped into the square leg region

ooh, that's well bowled. Stepped out, but did so a touch early and Williams responded with a slower ball, back of a length and wide of off. Reaches out and jabs, gets a leading edge that loops up to the right of backward point
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed towards short third man
flat, back of a length on off stump, makes room and flat-bats to long-off
flat, angling into the pads, clipped through backward square leg
uh oh, that's a bad ball. Short, flat, quick, angling down leg. Only needs to get a tickle on it, and he helps it away to the right of short fine leg to bring up his first boundary
flat, quick, and even further down the leg side now
shortish, just outside off, makes some room and stabs to the right of backward point. Good diving stop from Holder

tossed up slow, on off stump, and Pandya's just, only just cleared deep midwicket with the slog-sweep. Got a little too much under it, because it was a touch short to be playing that shot, but it just eludes the leaping, backtracking fielder on the boundary edge
back of a length angling down leg, tucked into the short fine leg region
pressure, yes. Goes for the wide yorker and it ends up marginally wide of the tramline
shortish, fairly wide of off, Dhoni is beaten trying to cut
wide and very full, steered out to deep point

looks for the wide yorker again, and slides past the tramline by a bigger margin. To be fair to him, Pandya took a huge back-and-across step even before he bowled, ended up with his back leg a long way outside off
and again, full and wide. This time Pandya leaves, and this time umpire Joel Wilson doesn't signal wide, even though this does end up outside the tramline
aaand again. A little wider, this time
length ball outside off, punched quietly to long-off
whoops, another wide yorker goes wrong.
full on a fifth-stump line, jabbed to deep point
full outside off, driven to long-off
bowled him! That is terrific. Pandya premeditated - I think fine leg was inside the circle - and shuffled across his stumps. Holder replied with a yorker that took out leg stump
back of a length, angling into the body, tucked off the hip between long leg and deep square leg

ooh, good short ball. Digs it in and the angle and extra bounce leave Jadeja cramped for room. Jumps, flaps uncertainly, and he's lucky that hits his bat and drops down only a few feet in front of him
yorker on middle and off, clipped to midwicket

back of a length on off stump, and Jadeja is nearly run out. Dawdles out of his crease after dabbing to the right of backward point. Kyle Hope moves quickly to his right to field, but misses the stumps with his throw. Replays show Jadeja was just in
shot. Just needed a touch on that, and he got a good
length ball on off stump, driven to long-off to bring up his slowest ODI fifty, off 108 balls. Previous slowest was 88 balls
slower ball on off stump, punched to the left of midwicket. Deep square leg had to move a fair way to his right, and they scamper two
in the blockhole on middle stump, jabbed down to long-off
shortish slower ball wide of off, slapped to deep point
back of a length, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, defended into the covers
slower ball close to off, dabbed down to third man
back of a length close to off, guided down to third man
low full-toss on middle stump, pushed down to long-on

slower ball, full, on off stump. India needed 17 off 16. A drive to long-on for one? Nope. Jadeja goes for the big slog, clears his front leg, goes hard, but there's no pace on the ball and he picks out the fielder at long-on
fullish, wide of off, poked to the right of deep point
length ball on middle and off. Looks to play across his front pad and work to midwicket, hits it straighter than he'd like and Holder fields it in his follow-through
slower ball outside off, Kuldeep plays and misses, looking to guide it to third man
dipping slower ball, full outside off. Looking to drive to long-off, Dhoni drags it back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to extra-cover, who's on the edge of the circle
nicely bowled. Mid-off was in the circle, and Kuldeep may have been eyeing that area while he made himself room. Follows him with a slower ball, and all he can do is jab into the point region
quick length ball now, fairly wide of off. Looks to slap it through point, can't connect. Again he tried to make room, and moved too early. Gave it away to the bowler
this time he moves the other way, across towards off stump. Bowls a full slower ball and he gives it a big slog. Only manages a top-edge that bounces down towards third man

full outside off, too full for Dhoni to get the elevation he wants, and he's hit it straight to long-on. Cleared his front leg, swung hard, and hit it flat and too close to Joseph, who moved a couple of steps to his right to take a waist-high catch
bowled him! Off-stump yorker and Umesh slogs all around it. They check for no-ball but Holder's foot is totally fine. This is his fourth wicket. 4 for 25 in 9.1 overs.
too full to get any elevation. Full and straight, he clears his front leg and swipes, all along the ground, to long-on
in the blockhole again, on the stumps. Clears his front leg and slogs and only manages a bottom-edge towards short fine leg

five-for! Holder's won it for West Indies! A full-toss on off stump, not the greatest ball he's bowled, but why would he care? Makes himself room, Shami, looks to hit over extra-cover, but can't clear the fielder. Side-on replays show it's just below waist-high, and that's when he's taken a stride forward
